channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- wp-eMember
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- wp-eMember

item.title: CVE-2024-5079|2024-07-15T18:34:02.301Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.7 does not sanitise and escape some of the fields when members register, which allows unauthenticated users to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks

item.title: CVE-2024-5075|2024-07-15T14:56:45.766Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.6 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2024-4749|2024-07-15T14:13:23.215Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.3.9 does not sanitize and escape the "fieldId" parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting.

item.title: CVE-2024-4749|2024-06-04T20:09:20.526Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.3.9 does not sanitize and escape the "fieldId" parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting.

item.title: CVE-2024-5744|2024-07-13T06:00:13.171Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.7 does not escape the $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] parameter before outputting it back in an attribute, which could lead to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting in old web browsers

item.title: CVE-2024-5075|2024-07-13T06:00:08.729Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.6 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2024-5074|2024-07-13T06:00:08.534Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.6 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2024-5079|2024-07-13T06:00:09.333Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.7 does not sanitise and escape some of the fields when members register, which allows unauthenticated users to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks

item.title: CVE-2024-5080|2024-07-13T06:00:09.543Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.6 does not validate files to be uploaded, which could allow admins to upload arbitrary files such as PHP on the server

item.title: CVE-2024-5715|2024-07-13T06:00:12.983Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.7 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2024-5076|2024-07-13T06:00:08.934Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.6 does not have CSRF checks in some places, which could allow attackers to make logged in users perform unwanted actions via CSRF attacks

item.title: CVE-2024-5077|2024-07-13T06:00:09.142Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.6 does not have CSRF check in some places, and is missing sanitisation as well as escaping, which could allow attackers to make logged in admin add Stored XSS payloads via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-5080|2024-07-15T16:49:49.740Z -- unknown -- wp-emember
item.description: The wp-eMember WordPress plugin before 10.6.6 does not validate files to be uploaded, which could allow admins to upload arbitrary files such as PHP on the server
